title: Calories in Egg Foo Young
meta_description: Discover calories in egg foo young per serving, including protein, carbs, fat, sodium details, and preparation tweaks for better nutrition tracking.
assumptions: Standard restaurant-style with eggs, vegetables (onions, bean sprouts), shrimp or pork, fried in oil, including brown gravy; approx. 200g per serving.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, protein type, oil amount, and restaurant; homemade versions differ. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One serving of egg foo young provides about 280 kcal, 18g protein, and is higher in sodium due to gravy.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one serving of egg foo young?
faqs.a: Approximately 280 kcal for a standard 200g serving with gravy.

faqs.q: Is egg foo young high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 18g protein per serving from eggs and added meat or shrimp.

faqs.q: What's the sodium content in egg foo young?
faqs.a: Around 800mg per serving, mostly from the gravy and soy sauce.

faqs.q: Can I make egg foo young lower in calories?
faqs.a: Yes, skip the gravy or bake instead of frying to reduce by 40-50 kcal.

faqs.q: How do carbs in egg foo young compare to other dishes?
faqs.a: About 15g carbs per serving, moderate due to veggies and gravy thickeners.
